author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 16-year-old girl from Madhya Pradesh, who was a participant in the National-Level Rural Sports Tournament underway at the Indira Gandhi sports stadium, was admitted to the Government Hospital for breathing problems on Wednesday night.

But the girl reportedly left the hospital and did not return to the sports venue.

A controversy erupted following allegations that the participant had used performance enhancing drugs.

A spokesperson of the tournament said that football, judo and weightlifting were the three events under progress.

The girl developed breathing problems and was immediately shifted in an ambulance to the GH on Wednesday night.

“The participant did not win any of the events. However, we have formally alerted the National Anti-Doping Agency (NADA) after allegations surfaced,” an organiser said.

title: Participant from MP at sports meet admitted to hospital
